description: A Python shell. Use this to execute python commands. Input should be a valid python command. If you want to see the output of a value, you should print it out with `print(...)`.

A tool used to get the current date and time.  Input is a time zone, in the format expected by the python pytz.timezone() call. Use the Python REPL Tool to get a list of valid time zones before calling this tool.
A tool that is useful for looking things up on wikipedia.
A tool that is useful for searching for things on the internet, this tool should be used when the answer to a user's query cannot be found with other tools or by your own knowledge.
A tool that is useful for listing all of the calendars a user has access to.

A tool that is useful for getting events in a specific calendar.  The input should be a calendar id, which can be found by using the List Calendars Tool.  If no calendar is specified by the user, the input should be 'primary'.
This gets replaced for this specific tool
A tool that is useful for getting the weather for a specific location.
